page.title: 16WEIR WOOD RESERVOIR
page.content: The{Weir Wood Reservoir}is owned and managed by the {Southern Water {Authority.}It was built in the early 1950's and its main purpose is to supply water to the population of the surrounding towns.However, the reservoir is now utilised in many different ways. The {Weir Wood Sailing {Club}caters for 420 enthusiastic members and race meetings are held most weekends. The shallow western end of the reservoir is prohibited to both sailors and anglers and provides a natural and unspoiled sanctuary of {80 {acres}for wildlife, especially waterfowl.{Angling}is also permitted and the trout fishing season extends from{April 1}to{September 30}each year.However, permits are needed and their issue is controlled by the Southern Water Authority.
